result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad R. Simmons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  
* 30 days credit if revoked from Probation *

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad R. Simmons

records.addlTxt: Judgment for unpaid fine/forfeiture/other not sent; no current address.
time to pay summary mailed to defendant.

9:30 AM cases 21CM988, 22CM146, 22CM310, and 22CM258 called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Chad R. Simmons in custody, in court.  Attorney Robert Allen Thorson in court for Chad R. Simmons. 
There is an agreement. Defendant acknowledges prior conviction in regard to Count 3 in 22CM258. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 3 as charged in the criminal complaint in 22CM258, Count 2 in 22CM146 as charged in the criminal complaint, Count 1 in 21CM988 as charged in the criminal complaint, and Count 2 in 22CM310 as charged in the criminal complaint. 

Court accepts pleas, finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
The court withholds sentencing and places defendant on Probation for 2 years with conditions: 
Complete AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Complete a mental health evaluation and follow through with recommendations. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs including applicable surcharges and provide a DNA sample on each count. 
On Count 2 in 22CM146: 180 days in jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Sentence credit in the event of a revocation as follows: 
22CM146: 3 days
21CM988: 5 days 
22CM310: 30 days 
22CM258: 4 days

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(Case called at 11:02 AM)
Defendant Chad Simmons appears in custody via videoconference from the jail with Attorney Katherine Cook.  Attorney Kelly Ronquist appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense waives reading of Complaint.  State requests $250 cash bond.  
Return Hearing: 5/10/2022 at 9:30 AM

Conditions:
No contact with District Bar.
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
